intro: Tingulonga ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty tingulonga, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and growth habits. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often in forested areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are long and pinnately compound, with a reddish-brown coloration on the underside, contributing to its common name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tingulonga ferruginea is considered a species of conservation concern.
